### Q1. Which component converts physiological variables into electrical signals?

a) Stimulus generator  
b) Transducer  
c) Display unit  
d) Control device  

### Q2. The electrical signals generated by the body are originally:

a) Digital  
b) Analog  
c) Optical  
d) Magnetic  

### Q3. Which electrode type is used to record signals from a single cell?

a) Skin surface electrode  
b) Needle electrode  
c) Microelectrode  
d) Suction electrode  

### Q4. What does the signal-conditioning unit mainly do?

a) Converts signals into chemical form  
b) Amplifies and filters weak electrical signals  
c) Stores the data  
d) Provides energy to the body  

### Q5. Which device provides a permanent paper record of physiological signals?

a) Oscilloscope  
b) Graphic pen recorder  
c) Amplifier  
d) Transducer
